intro: Astragalus oophorus var. lonchocalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitat.
